<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\file This file describes the interface of the Localizer pass.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This pass moves/duplicates constant-like instructions close to their uses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Its primarily goal is to workaround the deficiencies of the fast register</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><Highlight kind="comment">/// With GlobalISel constants are all materialized in the entry block of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><Highlight kind="comment">/// a function. However, the fast allocator cannot rematerialize constants and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><Highlight kind="comment">/// has a lot more live-ranges to deal with and will most likely end up</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><Highlight kind="comment">/// spilling a lot.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00017" /><CodeLine lineNumber="17"><Highlight kind="comment">/// By pushing the constants close to their use, we only create small</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00018" /><CodeLine lineNumber="18"><Highlight kind="comment">/// live-ranges.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;GLOBALISEL&#95;LOCALIZER&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;CODEGEN&#95;GLOBALISEL&#95;LOCALIZER&#95;H</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/targettransforminfo">TargetTransformInfo</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This pass implements the localization mechanism described at the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><Highlight kind="comment">/// top of this file. One specificity of the implementation is that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// it will materialize one and only one instance of a constant per</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// basic block, thus enabling reuse of that constant within that block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Moreover, it only materializes constants in blocks where they</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// are used. PHI uses are considered happening at the end of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><Highlight kind="comment">/// related predecessor.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/localizer"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/localizer/#a62ba443c3e6872953f937aaca117c8ba">Localizer</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinefunctionpass/#a29c81d2386f4a727c6d33413807530c8">MachineFunctionPass</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If the use is in the same block, we say it is local.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// When the use is not local, \\p InsertMBB will contain the basic</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// block when to insert \\p Def to have a local use.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
